consolePage.disconnectedMessage: Console got disconnected. We will try to reconnect once the server is back.

dashboard.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Dashboard
dashboard.description: The following graphs roll up information based on the selected Virtual Data Centre.

servers.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Servers
servers.description: View and manage any Managed or Self-Managed VDC servers. Dedicated and physical servers will be displayed in future versions of the portal.
servers.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of servers.

storageProfiles.title: Storage Profiles
storageProfiles.lowStorageSummary: {{storage_profile_number}} of your storage profiles {{verb}} running low on capacity.
storageProfiles.lowStorageProfile: You're running low on capacity in this profile.

serverDetailsStep.title: 1. Server Details
serverDetailsStep.loading: Loading server data, this may take a few minutes.

errors.invalidServerName: Server name can only contain letters, numbers or hypen.

contextualHelp.vdcField: Virtual Data Center to deploy your server. You can deploy your server to any Virtual Data Center available in this list.
contextualHelp.serverNameField: Choose a friendly name for your server. The server name must be 15 characters or less and contain letters, numbers and hyphens.
contextualHelp.vAppField: A vApp houses one or more servers. By default we create a vApp for each of your servers.
contextualHelp.intellicentre: Virtual Data Centre to deploy this Server in.
contextualHelp.serverTemplateField: Select the operating system or your own custom template to create this server from.
contextualHelp.computeField: Choose the memory and vCPU for your server. Click 'Enter custom size' to enter a precise value. Your selection is bound by the remaining compute in your Virtual Data Centre.
contextualHelp.storageField: Choose the profile and size of the server's primary storage volume. Click 'Enter custom size' to enter a precise value. Your selection is bound by the remaining capacity in the selected storage profile.
contextualHelp.serverName: Starting from an existing server's configuration helps you get a new server up and running quicker.
contextualHelp.networkField: Select the network to create a primary network interface for your server.
contextualHelp.ipAddressField: Select a method for acquiring the server's private IP address. Selecting DHCP will allocate an IP address on boot. Static Pool will give you the next available IP in the static pool.
contextualHelp.cloneServer: When you clone a server you get an identical copy of the existing server. it will have the same compute, storage and network characteristics. You can change the properties of server once it has been deployed.
contextualHelp.provisioningNotifications: We're currently deploying your server. Your server will be ready in a few minutes. Browsing to another page will not affect your server build. You can track progress from notifications area at the top of the portal.
contextualHelp.quickNavigateToCreatedServer: You can go back to server listing page to view your newly created server
contextualHelp.backToListing: This link would take you back to your server listing page

createSelfManagedServer.newServerDescription: Creating a new server allows you to specify the way your server will be built.
createSelfManagedServer.cloneServerDescription: Cloning a server gives you an exact replica of an existing server in the same Virtual Data Centre.

noResourceFound.content: No resources found. You can't create a server at this moment. Please try again later

createSelfManagedServer.noServers: No servers to clone. Create a new server first.
createSelfManagedServer.fullStorageSpace: This server cannot be created due to insufficient storage space ({{remaining_memory}} remaining).

nics.title: NICs
nics.noContentMessage: There are no NICs for this server.

media.title: Media
media.noContentMessage: No media is mounted for this server.

manageServices.title: Manage Services
manageServices.description: Ensure your server is fully protected. Enable and configure managed services for this server.

performanceScale.description: Scale your server for improved and better performance.
performanceScale.instruction: You can input a custom size for RAM and vCPU for scaling your VM. Alternatively, you can also click on select from slider and drag the slider to an appropriate size based on your needs.
performanceScale.sliderMessage: Select the RAM and CPU for this server from a slider.
performanceScale.customMessage: Manually enter the size of RAM and CPU for this server.
performanceScale.warning: Scaling the Server will require a restart.

storage.label: Storage
storage.title: Manage Disks
storage.description: Manage the disks attached to your server. You can add new, delete or expand existing disks.
storage.reachedStorageLimit: You've reached the maximum number of disks for this server.
storage.noDisks: No disks are attached to this server.
storage.fullStorageSpace: This disk cannot be created due to insufficient storage space (0 GB remaining).

backups.label: Backups
backups.snapshotDescription:
Snapshots are point-in-time VM-level restore points.
Restoring a snapshot is not reversible, so restore carefully.
backups.serverBackupsDescription: If something's not quite right with your server and you urgently need a restore, we can look into restoring a server-level backup for you.

nics.label: NICs
nics.title: Manage NICs
nics.primaryCheckbox: Make this the primary NIC for this server
nics.noNics: There are no NICs to display for this server.

serverIpAddress.customMessage: Warning: entering a custom IP address may cause conflicts if other servers in the network have this IP address assigned via another method.
serverIpAddress.defaultMessage: Selecting DHCP will allocate an IP address on boot. Static Pool will give you the next available IP in the static pool.

errors.ipAddressInvalid: Please enter a valid IP Address.
errors.ipAddressRangeError: IP Address must be in the range ({{ip_range}}).

renameServerDialog.title: Rename Server
renameServerDialog.information: Specify the new name for this server:

errors.invalidServerName:
Please ensure the new name meets the following criteria:
• Different to the current name
• Between 1 and 15 characters
• No special characters or spaces except - or _

resetPasswordDialog.title: Reset Server Password
resetPasswordDialog.poweredOnInfo: Resetting the server password requires a restart of your server. Are you sure you want to reset the password and restart server {{server_name}} now?
resetPasswordDialog.poweredOffInfo: Are you sure you want to reset the password for {{server_name}}?

resetPasswordFinishedDialog.title: Your Server Password
resetPasswordFinishedDialog.information: We've reset the password for server {{server_name}}.
resetPasswordFinishedDialog.warning: We won't show you this password again so we've emailed it to you for your reference.

deleteStorageDialog.title: Delete {{storage_name}}
deleteStorageDialog.alert: The data on {{storage_name}} will be lost forever.
deleteStorageDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this volume?

deleteNicDialog.title: Delete NIC {{network_name}}
deleteNicDialog.alert: The data on {{network_name}} will be lost forever.
deleteNicDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this NIC?

detachMediaDialog.title: Detach {{media_name}} Media
detachMediaDialog.alert: The data on {{media_name}} will be lost forever.
detachMediaDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you want to detach this media?

alert.single: Deleting a server cannot be undone. If this is the only remaining server in a vApp, the vApp will also be deleted.
alert.multiple: Deleting a server cannot be undone. If any server selected is the only remaining server in a vApp, the vApp will also be deleted.

deleteServerDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to continue?

restoreSnapshotDialog.title: Restore VM Snapshot
restoreSnapshotDialog.alert: Restoring a snapshot replaces data on the VM and cannot be undone. The server will be unavailable until this process is complete.
restoreSnapshotDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to restore {{snapshot_name}} to {{server_name}}?

deleteSnapshotDialog.title: Delete {{snapshot_name}}
deleteSnapshotDialog.alert: Deleting a snapshot cannot be undone.
deleteSnapshotDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to continue?

insufficientStorageSnapshotDialog.title: Insufficient Storage
insufficientStorageSnapshotDialog.alert: The VDC {{vdc_name}} does not have enough storage space available in order to capture a snapshot.
insufficientStorageSnapshotDialog.confirmation: Please remove any unneeded servers or snapshots and then try again.

createSnapshotDialog.title: New VM Snapshot
createSnapshotDialog.alert: Capturing a new snapshot will replace any existing snapshots for this VM.
createSnapshotDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to capture a new snapshot for {{server_name}}?

alert.single: Suspending a server will save its current state and pause any operations that are in progress.
alert.multiple: Suspending a server will save its current state and pause any operations that are in progress.

suspendServerDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to continue?

alert.single: After you resume a server, you cannot return to the state that the virtual machine was in when you suspended it. To return to the same state repeatedly, you must take a snapshot.
alert.multiple: After you resume a server, you cannot return to the state that the virtual machine was in when you suspended it. To return to the same state repeatedly, you must take a snapshot.

resumeServerDialog.confirmation: Are you sure you wish to continue?

storageScale.label: Storage
storageScale.sliderMessage: Select the disk size from a slider.

errors.storageMin: The minimum value that can be entered is {{min_value}}.

performanceScale.sliderMessage: Select the RAM and vCPU quantity for this server from a slider.
performanceScale.customMessage: Manually enter the RAM and vCPU quantity for this server.

errors.ramMin: The minimum value that can be entered is {{min_value}}.
errors.ramInvalid: Memory size must be a multiple of {{multiple}} MB.
errors.cpuMin: The minimum value that can be entered is {{min_value}}.
errors.cpuMax: The number of vCPUs should not exceed {{available_cpu}}.

tickets.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Tickets
tickets.description: Below is the list of your Macquarie Cloud Services tickets.
tickets.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of tickets.

ticket.creatingComment: Creating your comment, this may take a few minutes.

createTicket.description:
We all need help from time to time.

Our qualified team of Hosting Management Centre professionals are on standby 24x7 to help you get to the bottom of your issue.

Provide us with as much information as you can and we'll take a look.

Existing tickets can be viewed and managed in MacquarieView.
createTicket.creatingTicket: Creating ticket, this may take a few minutes.

errors.typeRequired: You must select a ticket type.

contextualHelp.headline: A short title that describes this ticket.
contextualHelp.details: Please provide as much information as you can and describe any attempts made to remedy the problem
contextualHelp.services: Choose the service type this ticket relates to.
contextualHelp.attachments: Optionally attach screenshots or other files to this support ticket by dragging and dropping into this area from your computer (limit 1 file).

firewalls.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Networking
firewalls.description: View details of your firewalls and firewall policies. Firewalls prevent malicious traffic from accessing services deployed in your environment.
firewalls.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of firewalls.

policies.label: Policies
policies.description: Firewall policies specify the permissible and forbidden traffic at the network perimeter. View details of your firewall policies here.
policies.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of firewall policies.

tools.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Other Tools
tools.description: Macquarie Cloud Services have all the tools you need to manage your compute workloads. Occasionally you may want to do something that's not possible in the Macquarie Cloud Services portal, but available in our partner portals. You have permission to access the following partner portals.

macquarieView.name: Macquarie View
macquarieView.description: Manage company contacts, users, invoices and monitor your infrastructure.

vCloud.name: Vcloud Director
vCloud.description: Manage your Virtual Machines and Virtual Data Centers.

vSphere.name: vSphere
vSphere.description: Manage every detail of your virtual data centres.

zerto.name: Zerto
zerto.description: True High Availability, at the click of a button.

ciscoUcs.name: Cisco UCS
ciscoUcs.description: Unified management of all server hardware managed under one umbrella.

f5.name: F5
f5.description: Manage load balancing and SSL offload.

table.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of other tools.

notifications.title: Macquarie Cloud Services: Notifications
notifications.description: Notifications play back and track activity within the portal.
notifications.errorMessage: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the list of notifications.
